<li id="cite_note-212"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-212" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite class="citation cs2"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.biodiversitya-z.org/content/megadiverse-countries"><i>Megadiverse Countries</i></a>, Biodiversity A–Z, <a href="/wiki/World_Conservation_Monitoring_Centre" title="World Conservation Monitoring Centre">UN Environment World Conservation Monitoring Centre</a><span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">17 October</span> 2021</span></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Megadiverse+Countries&amp;rft.pub=Biodiversity+A%E2%80%93Z%2C+UN+Environment+World+Conservation+Monitoring+Centre&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.biodiversitya-z.org%2Fcontent%2Fmegadiverse-countries&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-Jha2018-218"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Jha2018_218-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Jha2018_218-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Jha2018_218-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Jha2018_218-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFJha2018" class="citation cs2">Jha, Raghbendra (2018), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=9n9SDwAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA198"><i>Facets of India's Economy and Her Society Volume II: Current State and Future Prospects</i></a>, <a href="/wiki/Springer_Publishing" title="Springer Publishing">Springer</a>, p.&nbsp;198, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-349-95342-4" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-349-95342-4"><bdi>978-1-349-95342-4</bdi></a></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Facets+of+India%27s+Economy+and+Her+Society+Volume+II%3A+Current+State+and+Future+Prospects&amp;rft.pages=198&amp;rft.pub=Springer&amp;rft.date=2018&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-349-95342-4&amp;rft.aulast=Jha&amp;rft.aufirst=Raghbendra&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3D9n9SDwAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA198&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-indiaforest-219"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-indiaforest_219-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-indiaforest_219-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-indiaforest_219-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.frienvis.nic.in/Database/Forest-Cover-in-States-UTs-2019_2478.aspx">"Forest Cover in States/UTs in India in 2019"</a>. <a href="/wiki/Forest_Research_Institute_(India)" title="Forest Research Institute (India)">Forest Research Institute</a> via <a href="/wiki/National_Informatics_Centre" title="National Informatics Centre">National Informatics Centre</a><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">16 October</span> 2021</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Forest+Cover+in+States%2FUTs+in+India+in+2019&amp;rft.pub=Forest+Research+Institute+via+National+Informatics+Centre&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.frienvis.nic.in%2FDatabase%2FForest-Cover-in-States-UTs-2019_2478.aspx&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTETritsch200111–12-220"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTETritsch200111–12_220-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFTritsch2001">Tritsch 2001</a>, pp.&nbsp;11–12.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTETritsch200112-221"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTETritsch200112_221-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFTritsch2001">Tritsch 2001</a>, p.&nbsp;12India has two natural zones of thorn forest, one in the rain shadow area of the Deccan Plateau east of the Western Ghats, and the other in the western part of the Indo-Gangetic plain. Growth is limited only by moisture availability in these areas, so with irrigation the fertile alluvial soil of Punjab and Haryana has been turned into India's prime agricultural area. Much of the thorn forest covering the plains probably had savannah-like features now no longer visible.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Goyal2006-222"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Goyal2006_222-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFGoyal2006" class="citation cs2">Goyal, Anupam (2006), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=UTGQAAAAMAAJ&amp;pg=PA295"><i>The WTO and International Environmental Law: Towards Conciliation</i></a>, <a href="/wiki/Oxford_University_Press" title="Oxford University Press">Oxford University Press</a>, p.&nbsp;295, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-19-567710-2" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-19-567710-2"><bdi>978-0-19-567710-2</bdi></a></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+WTO+and+International+Environmental+Law%3A+Towards+Conciliation&amp;rft.pages=295&amp;rft.pub=Oxford+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2006&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-19-567710-2&amp;rft.aulast=Goyal&amp;rft.aufirst=Anupam&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DUTGQAAAAMAAJ%26pg%3DPA295&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span> Quote: "The Indian government successfully argued that the medicinal <i>neem</i> tree is part of traditional Indian knowledge. (page 295)"</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Hughes2013-223"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Hughes2013_223-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFHughes2013" class="citation cs2">Hughes, Julie E. (2013), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=RL8qWNmpkc0C&amp;pg=PT106"><i>Animal Kingdoms</i></a>, <a href="/wiki/Harvard_University_Press" title="Harvard University Press">Harvard University Press</a>, p.&nbsp;106, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-674-07480-4" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-674-07480-4"><bdi>978-0-674-07480-4</bdi></a>, <q>At same time, the leafy pipal trees and comparative abundance that marked the Mewari landscape fostered refinements unattainable in other lands.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Animal+Kingdoms&amp;rft.pages=106&amp;rft.pub=Harvard+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2013&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-674-07480-4&amp;rft.aulast=Hughes&amp;rft.aufirst=Julie+E.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DRL8qWNmpkc0C%26pg%3DPT106&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-AmeriCostello2018-224"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-AmeriCostello2018_224-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFAmeri2018" class="citation cs2">Ameri, Marta (2018), "Letting the Pictures Speak: An Image-Based Approach to the Mythological and Narrative Imagery of the Harappan World", in Ameri, Marta; Costello, Sarah Kielt; Jamison, Gregg; Scott, Sarah Jarmer (eds.), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=SklVDwAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA156"><i>Seals and Sealing in the Ancient World: Case Studies from the Near East, Egypt, the Aegean, and South Asia</i></a>, <a href="/wiki/Cambridge_University_Press" title="Cambridge University Press">Cambridge University Press</a>, pp.&nbsp;156–157, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-108-17351-3" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-108-17351-3"><bdi>978-1-108-17351-3</bdi></a></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Letting+the+Pictures+Speak%3A+An+Image-Based+Approach+to+the+Mythological+and+Narrative+Imagery+of+the+Harappan+World&amp;rft.btitle=Seals+and+Sealing+in+the+Ancient+World%3A+Case+Studies+from+the+Near+East%2C+Egypt%2C+the+Aegean%2C+and+South+Asia&amp;rft.pages=156-157&amp;rft.pub=Cambridge+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2018&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-108-17351-3&amp;rft.aulast=Ameri&amp;rft.aufirst=Marta&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DSklVDwAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA156&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span> Quote: "The last of the centaurs has the long, wavy, horizontal horns of a markhor, a human face, a heavy-set body that appears bovine, and a goat tail ... This figure is often depicted by itself, but it is also consistently represented in scenes that seem to reflect the adoration of a figure in a pipal tree or arbour and which may be termed ritual. These include fully detailed scenes like that visible in the large 'divine adoration' seal from Mohenjo-daro."</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Gwynne2011-225"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Gwynne2011_225-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFPaul_Gwynne2011" class="citation cs2">Paul Gwynne (2011), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=tdsRKc_knZoC&amp;pg=RA5-PT195"><i>World Religions in Practice: A Comparative Introduction</i></a>, <a href="/wiki/John_Wiley_%26_Sons" class="mw-redirect" title="John Wiley &amp; Sons">John Wiley &amp; Sons</a>, p.&nbsp;358, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-4443-6005-9" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-4443-6005-9"><bdi>978-1-4443-6005-9</bdi></a>, <q>The tree under which Sakyamuni became the Buddha is a peepal tree (<i><a href="/wiki/Ficus_religiosa" title="Ficus religiosa">Ficus religiosa</a></i>).</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=World+Religions+in+Practice%3A+A+Comparative+Introduction&amp;rft.pages=358&amp;rft.pub=John+Wiley+%26+Sons&amp;rft.date=2011&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-4443-6005-9&amp;rft.au=Paul+Gwynne&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DtdsRKc_knZoC%26pg%3DRA5-PT195&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTECrameOwen2002142-226"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTECrameOwen2002142_226-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFCrameOwen2002">Crame &amp; Owen 2002</a>, p.&nbsp;142.</span>

<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTETritsch200114-228"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTETritsch200114_228-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFTritsch2001">Tritsch 2001</a>, p.&nbsp;14.</span>

<li id="cite_note-229"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-229" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFSingh,_M.Kumar,_A.Molur,_S.2008" class="citation journal cs1">Singh, M.; Kumar, A. &amp; Molur, S. (2008). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.2305%2FIUCN.UK.2008.RLTS.T44694A10927987.en">"Trachypithecus johnii"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_IUCN_Red_List_of_Threatened_Species" class="mw-redirect" title="The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species">The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species</a></i>. <b>2008</b>. e.T44694A10927987. <a href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.2305%2FIUCN.UK.2008.RLTS.T44694A10927987.en">10.2305/IUCN.UK.2008.RLTS.T44694A10927987.en</a></span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+IUCN+Red+List+of+Threatened+Species&amp;rft.atitle=Trachypithecus+johnii&amp;rft.volume=2008&amp;rft.pages=e.T44694A10927987&amp;rft.date=2008&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.2305%2FIUCN.UK.2008.RLTS.T44694A10927987.en&amp;rft.au=Singh%2C+M.&amp;rft.au=Kumar%2C+A.&amp;rft.au=Molur%2C+S.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fdoi.org%2F10.2305%252FIUCN.UK.2008.RLTS.T44694A10927987.en&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-itis-230"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-itis_230-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFFischer" class="citation web cs1"><a href="/wiki/Johann_Baptist_Fischer" title="Johann Baptist Fischer">Fischer, Johann</a>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.itis.gov/servlet/SingleRpt/SingleRpt?search_topic=TSN&amp;search_value=944270#null">"Semnopithecus johnii"</a>. <a href="/wiki/ITIS" class="mw-redirect" title="ITIS">ITIS</a>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20180829072131/https://www.itis.gov/servlet/SingleRpt/SingleRpt?search_topic=TSN&amp;search_value=944270#null">Archived</a> from the original on 29 August 2018<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">27 August</span> 2018</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Semnopithecus+johnii&amp;rft.pub=ITIS&amp;rft.aulast=Fischer&amp;rft.aufirst=Johann&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.itis.gov%2Fservlet%2FSingleRpt%2FSingleRpt%3Fsearch_topic%3DTSN%26search_value%3D944270%23null&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-IUCN-231"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-IUCN_231-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-IUCN_231-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFS.D._BijuSushil_DuttaM.S._Ravichandran_Karthikeyan_VasudevanS.P._Vijayakumar2004" class="citation journal cs1">S.D. Biju; Sushil Dutta; M.S. Ravichandran Karthikeyan Vasudevan; S.P. Vijayakumar; Chelmala Srinivasulu; Gajanan Dasaramji Bhuddhe (2004). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.2305%2FIUCN.UK.2004.RLTS.T54584A11155448.en">"Duttaphrynus beddomii"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_IUCN_Red_List_of_Threatened_Species" class="mw-redirect" title="The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species">The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species</a></i>. <a href="/wiki/IUCN" class="mw-redirect" title="IUCN">IUCN</a>. <b>2004</b>: e.T54584A86543952. <a href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.2305%2FIUCN.UK.2004.RLTS.T54584A11155448.en">10.2305/IUCN.UK.2004.RLTS.T54584A11155448.en</a></span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+IUCN+Red+List+of+Threatened+Species&amp;rft.atitle=Duttaphrynus+beddomii&amp;rft.volume=2004&amp;rft.pages=e.T54584A86543952&amp;rft.date=2004&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.2305%2FIUCN.UK.2004.RLTS.T54584A11155448.en&amp;rft.au=S.D.+Biju&amp;rft.au=Sushil+Dutta&amp;rft.au=M.S.+Ravichandran+Karthikeyan+Vasudevan&amp;rft.au=S.P.+Vijayakumar&amp;rft.au=Chelmala+Srinivasulu&amp;rft.au=Gajanan+Dasaramji+Bhuddhe&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fdoi.org%2F10.2305%252FIUCN.UK.2004.RLTS.T54584A11155448.en&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-232"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-232" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFFrost,_Darrel_R.2015" class="citation web cs1">Frost, Darrel R. (2015). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://research.amnh.org/vz/herpetology/amphibia/Amphibia/Anura/Bufonidae/Duttaphrynus/Duttaphrynus-beddomii">"<i>Duttaphrynus beddomii</i> (Günther, 1876)"</a>. <i>Amphibian Species of the World: an Online Reference. <li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEMace19944-233"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEMace19944_233-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFMace1994">Mace 1994</a>, p.&nbsp;4.</span>

<li id="cite_note-LovetteFitzpatrick2016-234"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-LovetteFitzpatrick2016_234-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFLovetteFitzpatrick2016" class="citation cs2">Lovette, Irby J.; Fitzpatrick, John W. (2016), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=OGyQDAAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA599"><i>Handbook of Bird Biology</i></a>, <a href="/wiki/John_Wiley_%26_Sons" class="mw-redirect" title="John Wiley &amp; Sons">John Wiley &amp; Sons</a>, p.&nbsp;599, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-118-29105-4" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-118-29105-4"><bdi>978-1-118-29105-4</bdi></a></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Handbook+of+Bird+Biology&amp;rft.pages=599&amp;rft.pub=John+Wiley+%26+Sons&amp;rft.date=2016&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-118-29105-4&amp;rft.aulast=Lovette&amp;rft.aufirst=Irby+J.&amp;rft.au=Fitzpatrick%2C+John+W.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DOGyQDAAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA599&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTETritsch200115-235"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTETritsch200115_235-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFTritsch2001">Tritsch 2001</a>, p.&nbsp;15Before it was so heavily settled and intensively exploited, the Punjab was dominated by thorn forest interspersed by rolling grasslands which were grazed on by millions of Blackbuck, accompanied by their dominant predator, the Cheetah. Always keen hunters, the Moghul princes kept tame cheetahs which were used to chase and bring down the Blackbuck. Today the Cheetah is extinct in India and the severely endangered Blackbuck no longer exists in the Punjab.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEMinistry_of_Environment_and_Forests_1972-236"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEMinistry_of_Environment_and_Forests_1972_236-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFMinistry_of_Environment_and_Forests_1972">Ministry of Environment and Forests 1972</a>.</span>

<li id="cite_note-257"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-257" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite class="citation news cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20140521032413/https://www.dnaindia.com/india/report-bjp-first-party-since-1984-to-win-parliamentary-majority-on-its-own-1988981">"BJP first party since 1984 to win parliamentary majority on its own"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Daily_News_and_Analysis" title="Daily News and Analysis">DNA</a></i>. Indo-Asian News Service. 16 May 2014. <li id="cite_note-Dinkel2018-286"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Dinkel2018_286-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFDinkel2018" class="citation book cs1">Dinkel, Jürgen (2018). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=YqOODwAAQBAJ"><i>The Non-Aligned Movement: Genesis, Organization and Politics (1927–1992)</i></a>. <a href="/wiki/Brill_Publishers" title="Brill Publishers">Brill</a>. pp.&nbsp;92–93. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-90-04-33613-1" title="Special:BookSources/978-90-04-33613-1"><bdi>978-90-04-33613-1</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Non-Aligned+Movement%3A+Genesis%2C+Organization+and+Politics+%281927%E2%80%931992%29&amp;rft.pages=92-93&amp;rft.pub=Brill&amp;rft.date=2018&amp;rft.isbn=978-90-04-33613-1&amp;rft.aulast=Dinkel&amp;rft.aufirst=J%C3%BCrgen&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DYqOODwAAQBAJ&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTERothermund200048,_227-287"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTERothermund200048,_227_287-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFRothermund2000">Rothermund 2000</a>, pp.&nbsp;48, 227.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-62-humiliation-288"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-62-humiliation_288-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">(a) <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFGuyot-Rechard2017" class="citation cs2">Guyot-Rechard, Berenice (2017), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=FbktDQAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA235"><i>Shadow States: India, China and the Himalayas, 1910–1962</i></a>, Cambridge University Press, p.&nbsp;235, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-107-17679-9" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-107-17679-9"><bdi>978-1-107-17679-9</bdi></a>, <q>By invading NEFA, the PRC did not just aim to force a humiliated India to recognise its possession of the Aksai Chin.  It also hoped to get, once and for all, the upper hand in their shadowing competition.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Shadow+States%3A+India%2C+China+and+the+Himalayas%2C+1910%E2%80%931962&amp;rft.pages=235&amp;rft.pub=Cambridge+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2017&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-107-17679-9&amp;rft.aulast=Guyot-Rechard&amp;rft.aufirst=Berenice&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DFbktDQAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA235&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span>
<br>(b) <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFChubb2021" class="citation cs2">Chubb, Andrew (2021), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=D1crEAAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA230">"The Sino-Indian Border Crisis: Chinese Perceptions of Indian Nationalism"</a>, in Golley, Jane; Jaivan, Linda; Strange, Sharon (eds.), <i>Crisis</i>, Australian National University Press, pp.&nbsp;231–232, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-76046-439-4" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-76046-439-4"><bdi>978-1-76046-439-4</bdi></a>, <q>The ensuing cycle of escalation culminated in the 1962 Sino-Indian border war in which Mao Zedong's troops overran almost the entire state of Arunachal Pradesh in the eastern sector before unilaterally withdrawing, as if to underline the insult; most of the war's several thousand casualties were Indian. The PLA's decisive victories in the 1962 war not only humiliated the Indian Army, they also entrenched a status quo in Ladakh that was highly unfavourable for India, in which China controls almost all of the disputed territory. A nationalistic press and commentariat have kept 1962 vivid in India's popular consciousness.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=The+Sino-Indian+Border+Crisis%3A+Chinese+Perceptions+of+Indian+Nationalism&amp;rft.btitle=Crisis&amp;rft.pages=231-232&amp;rft.pub=Australian+National+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2021&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-76046-439-4&amp;rft.aulast=Chubb&amp;rft.aufirst=Andrew&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DD1crEAAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA230&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span>
<br>(c) <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFLintner2018" class="citation cs2">Lintner, Bertil (2018), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=-L9DDwAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PT106"><i>China's India War: Collision Course on the Roof of the World</i></a>, Oxford University Press, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-19-909163-8" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-19-909163-8"><bdi>978-0-19-909163-8</bdi></a>, <q>Lin Biao was put in charge of the operation and that alliance between Mao and his loyal de facto chief of the PLA made the attack on India possible. With China's ultimate victory in the war, Mao's ultra-leftist line had won in China; whatever critical voices that were left in the Party after all the purges fell silent.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=China%27s+India+War%3A+Collision+Course+on+the+Roof+of+the+World&amp;rft.pub=Oxford+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2018&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-19-909163-8&amp;rft.aulast=Lintner&amp;rft.aufirst=Bertil&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3D-L9DDwAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPT106&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span>
<br>(d) <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFMedcalf2020" class="citation cs2">Medcalf, Rory (2020), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=RCjXDwAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PT81"><i>Indo-Pacific Empire: China, America and the contest for the world's pivotal</i></a>, Manchester University Press, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-5261-5077-6" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-5261-5077-6"><bdi>978-1-5261-5077-6</bdi></a>, <q>From an Indian perspective, the China-India war of 1962 was a shocking betrayal of the principles of co-operation and coexistence: a surprise attack that humiliated India and personally broke Nehru.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Indo-Pacific+Empire%3A+China%2C+America+and+the+contest+for+the+world%27s+pivotal&amp;rft.pub=Manchester+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2020&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-5261-5077-6&amp;rft.aulast=Medcalf&amp;rft.aufirst=Rory&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DRCjXDwAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPT81&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span>
<br>(e) <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFGanguly1997" class="citation cs2">Ganguly, Sumit (1997), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=Fi66mjIqR1IC&amp;pg=PA44"><i>The Crisis in Kashmir: Portents of War, Hope of Peace</i></a>, Woodrow Wilson Center Press and Cambridge University Press, p.&nbsp;44, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-521-65566-8" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-521-65566-8"><bdi>978-0-521-65566-8</bdi></a>, <q>In October 1962 India suffered the most humiliating military debacle in its post-independence history, at the hands of the Chinese People's Liberation Army (PLA). The outcome of this conflict had far-reaching consequences for Indian foreign and defence policies. The harsh defeat that the Chinese PLA had inflicted on the Indian Army called into question some of the most deeply held precepts of Nehru's foreign and defence policies.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Crisis+in+Kashmir%3A+Portents+of+War%2C+Hope+of+Peace&amp;rft.pages=44&amp;rft.pub=Woodrow+Wilson+Center+Press+and+Cambridge+University+Press&amp;rft.date=1997&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-521-65566-8&amp;rft.aulast=Ganguly&amp;rft.aufirst=Sumit&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DFi66mjIqR1IC%26pg%3DPA44&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span>
<br>(f) <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFRaghavan2019" class="citation cs2">Raghavan, Srinath (2019), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=h-yoDwAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA121">"A Missed Opportunity? The Nehru-Zhou Enlai Summit of 1960"</a>, in Bhagavan, Manu (ed.), <i>India and the Cold War</i>, University of North Carolina Press, p.&nbsp;121, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-4696-5117-0" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-4696-5117-0"><bdi>978-1-4696-5117-0</bdi></a>, <q>The 'forward policy' adopted by India to prevent the Chinese from occupying territory claimed by them was undertaken in the mistaken belief that Beijing would be cautious in dealing with India owing to Moscow's stance on the dispute and its growing proximity to India. These misjudgments would eventually culminate in India's humiliating defeat in the war of October–November 1962.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=A+Missed+Opportunity%3F+The+Nehru-Zhou+Enlai+Summit+of+1960&amp;rft.btitle=India+and+the+Cold+War&amp;rft.pages=121&amp;rft.pub=University+of+North+Carolina+Press&amp;rft.date=2019&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-4696-5117-0&amp;rft.aulast=Raghavan&amp;rft.aufirst=Srinath&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3Dh-yoDwAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA121&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-289"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-289" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFBrahma_Chellaney2006" class="citation book cs1"><a href="/wiki/Brahma_Chellaney" title="Brahma Chellaney">Brahma Chellaney</a> (2006). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=ZCmFAAAAMAAJ"><i>Asian Juggernaut: The Rise of China, India, and Japan</i></a>. <a href="/wiki/HarperCollins" title="HarperCollins">HarperCollins</a>. p.&nbsp;195. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-8172236502" title="Special:BookSources/978-8172236502"><bdi>978-8172236502</bdi></a>. <q>Indeed, Beijing's acknowledgement of Indian control over Sikkim seems limited to the purpose of facilitating trade through the vertiginous Nathu-la Pass, the scene of bloody artillery duels in September 1967 when Indian troops beat back attacking Chinese forces.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Asian+Juggernaut%3A+The+Rise+of+China%2C+India%2C+and+Japan&amp;rft.pages=195&amp;rft.pub=HarperCollins&amp;rft.date=2006&amp;rft.isbn=978-8172236502&amp;rft.au=Brahma+Chellaney&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DZCmFAAAAMAAJ&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-292"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-292" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFGvosdevMarsh2013" class="citation book cs1">Gvosdev, N.K.; Marsh, C. <li id="cite_note-guardian-muir-diary-maratha-297"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-guardian-muir-diary-maratha_297-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFMuir2009" class="citation cs2">Muir, Hugh (13 July 2009), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20141019165743/https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2009/jul/14/bbc-peter-salmon-trevor-mcdonald">"Diary"</a>, <i><a href="/wiki/The_Guardian" title="The Guardian">The Guardian</a></i>, archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2009/jul/14/bbc-peter-salmon-trevor-mcdonald">the original</a> on 19 October 2014<span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">17 October</span> 2021</span>, <q>Members of the Indian armed forces have the plum job of leading off the great morning parade for Bastille Day. Only after units and bands from India's navy and air force have followed the Maratha Light Infantry will the parade be entirely given over to ... France's armed services.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Guardian&amp;rft.atitle=Diary&amp;rft.date=2009-07-13&amp;rft.aulast=Muir&amp;rft.aufirst=Hugh&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.theguardian.com%2Fpolitics%2F2009%2Fjul%2F14%2Fbbc-peter-salmon-trevor-mcdonald&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-303"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-303" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFIyer-MitraDas" class="citation web cs1">Iyer-Mitra, Abhijit; Das, Pushan. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://dhqxnzzajv69c.cloudfront.net/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/IssueBrief_105.pdf">"The Advanced Medium Combat Aircraft:A Technical Analysis"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i><a href="/wiki/Observer_Research_Foundation" title="Observer Research Foundation">Observer Research Foundation</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-370"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-370" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/economy/indicators/indias-rank-improves-to-55th-position-on-global-hunger-index/articleshow/44802193.cms">"India's rank improves to 55th position on global hunger index"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Economic_Times" title="The Economic Times">The Economic Times</a></i>. 13 October 2014. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20141019030848/https://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2014-10-13/news/54970880_1_nutrition-mission-india-ghi">Archived</a> from the original on 19 October 2014<span class="reference-accessdate">. </li>
<li id="cite_note-371"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-371" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFInternet_Desk2015" class="citation news cs1">Internet Desk (28 May 2015). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20161202044027/https://www.thehindu.com/news/national/india-is-home-to-194-million-hungry-people-un/article7255937.ece">"India is home to 194 million hungry people: UN"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Hindu" title="The Hindu">The Hindu</a></i>. <li id="cite_note-468"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-468" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFBiswas2016" class="citation news cs1">Biswas, Soutik (29 September 2016). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-37481054">"What divorce and separation tell us about modern India"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/BBC_News" title="BBC News">BBC News</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTECullen-Dupont200996-469"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTECullen-Dupont200996_469-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFCullen-Dupont2009">Cullen-Dupont 2009</a>, p.&nbsp;96.</span>

<li id="cite_note-The_Hindu_November_17_2019c-470"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-The_Hindu_November_17_2019c_470-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFKapoorShamika2014" class="citation news cs1">Kapoor, Mudit; Shamika, Ravi (10 February 2014). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.thehindu.com/opinion/lead/indias-missing-women/article5670801.ece">"India's missing women"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Hindu" title="The Hindu">The Hindu</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">17 November</span> 2019</span>. <q>In the last 50 years of Indian democracy, the absolute number of missing women has increased fourfold from 15 million to 68 million. This is not merely a reflection of the growth in the overall population, but, rather, of the fact that this dangerous trend has worsened with time. As a percentage of the female electorate, missing women have gone up significantly — from 13 per cent to approximately 20 per cent</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Hindu&amp;rft.atitle=India%27s+missing+women&amp;rft.date=2014-02-10&amp;rft.aulast=Kapoor&amp;rft.aufirst=Mudit&amp;rft.au=Shamika%2C+Ravi&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.thehindu.com%2Fopinion%2Flead%2Findias-missing-women%2Farticle5670801.ece&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-The_Guardian_November_17_2019c-471"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-The_Guardian_November_17_2019c_471-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/jan/30/more-than-63-million-women-missing-in-india-statistics-show">"More than 63 million women 'missing' in India, statistics show"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Associated_Press" title="Associated Press">Associated Press</a> via <a href="/wiki/The_Guardian" title="The Guardian">The Guardian</a></i>. 30 January 2018<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">17 November</span> 2019</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Associated+Press+via+The+Guardian&amp;rft.atitle=More+than+63+million+women+%27missing%27+in+India%2C+statistics+show&amp;rft.date=2018-01-30&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.theguardian.com%2Fworld%2F2018%2Fjan%2F30%2Fmore-than-63-million-women-missing-in-india-statistics-show&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span> Quote: "More than 63 million women are "missing" statistically across India, and more than 21 million girls are unwanted by their families, government officials say. The skewed ratio of men to women is largely the result of sex-selective abortions, and better nutrition and medical care for boys, according to the government's annual economic survey, which was released on Monday. In addition, the survey found that "families where a son is born are more likely to stop having children than families where a girl is born".</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Foreign_Policy_November_17_2019c-472"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Foreign_Policy_November_17_2019c_472-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFTrivedi2019" class="citation web cs1">Trivedi, Ira (15 August 2019). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://foreignpolicy.com/2019/08/15/a-generation-of-girls-is-missing-in-india/">"A Generation of Girls Is Missing in India – Sex-selective abortion fuels a cycle of patriarchy and abuse"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Foreign_Policy" title="Foreign Policy">Foreign Policy</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">17 November</span> 2019</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Foreign+Policy&amp;rft.atitle=A+Generation+of+Girls+Is+Missing+in+India+%E2%80%93+Sex-selective+abortion+fuels+a+cycle+of+patriarchy+and+abuse.&amp;rft.date=2019-08-15&amp;rft.aulast=Trivedi&amp;rft.aufirst=Ira&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fforeignpolicy.com%2F2019%2F08%2F15%2Fa-generation-of-girls-is-missing-in-india%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span> Quote: "Although it has been illegal nationwide for doctors to disclose the sex of a fetus since the 1994 Pre-Conception and Pre-Natal Diagnostic Techniques Act, the ease of ordering cheap and portable ultrasound machines, especially online, has kept the practice of sex-selective abortions alive."</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-473"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-473" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFNelson2013" class="citation news cs1">Nelson, Dean (2 September 2013). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20140323074436/https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/india/10280802/Woman-killed-over-dowry-every-hour-in-India.html">"Woman killed over dowry 'every hour' in India"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Daily_Telegraph" title="The Daily Telegraph">The Daily Telegraph</a></i>. <li id="cite_note-Dwyer2014-492"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Dwyer2014_492-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Dwyer2014_492-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Dwyer2014_492-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Dwyer2014_492-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Dwyer2014_492-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFDwyer2014" class="citation cs2"><a href="/wiki/Rachel_Dwyer" title="Rachel Dwyer">Dwyer, Rachel</a> (2014), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=DqwBBQAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA244"><i>Bollywood's India: Hindi Cinema as a Guide to Contemporary India</i></a>, <a href="/wiki/Reaktion_Books" title="Reaktion Books">Reaktion Books</a>, pp.&nbsp;244–245, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-78023-304-8" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-78023-304-8"><bdi>978-1-78023-304-8</bdi></a></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Bollywood%27s+India%3A+Hindi+Cinema+as+a+Guide+to+Contemporary+India&amp;rft.pages=244-245&amp;rft.pub=Reaktion+Books&amp;rft.date=2014&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-78023-304-8&amp;rft.aulast=Dwyer&amp;rft.aufirst=Rachel&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DDqwBBQAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA244&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-BruzziGibson2013-493"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-BruzziGibson2013_493-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFDwyer2013" class="citation cs2"><a href="/wiki/Rachel_Dwyer" title="Rachel Dwyer">Dwyer, Rachel</a> (2013), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=FYGMAQAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA178">"Bombay Ishtyle"</a>, in Stella Bruzzi, Pamela Church Gibson (ed.), <i>Fashion Cultures: Theories, Explorations and Analysis</i>, <a href="/wiki/Routledge" title="Routledge">Routledge</a>, pp.&nbsp;178–189, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-136-29537-9" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-136-29537-9"><bdi>978-1-136-29537-9</bdi></a></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Bombay+Ishtyle&amp;rft.btitle=Fashion+Cultures%3A+Theories%2C+Explorations+and+Analysis&amp;rft.pages=178-189&amp;rft.pub=Routledge&amp;rft.date=2013&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-136-29537-9&amp;rft.aulast=Dwyer&amp;rft.aufirst=Rachel&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DFYGMAQAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA178&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Davidson2014-p409-494"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Davidson2014-p409_494-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Davidson2014-p409_494-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Davidson2014-p409_494-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFDavidson2014" class="citation cs2">Davidson, Alan (2014), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=RL6LAwAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA409"><i>The Oxford Companion to Food</i></a>, <a href="/wiki/Oxford_University_Press" title="Oxford University Press">Oxford University Press</a>, p.&nbsp;409, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-19-967733-7" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-19-967733-7"><bdi>978-0-19-967733-7</bdi></a></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Oxford+Companion+to+Food&amp;rft.pages=409&amp;rft.pub=Oxford+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2014&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-19-967733-7&amp;rft.aulast=Davidson&amp;rft.aufirst=Alan&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DRL6LAwAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA409&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Davidson2014-p161-495"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Davidson2014-p161_495-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFDavidson2014" class="citation cs2">Davidson, Alan (2014), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=RL6LAwAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA161"><i>The Oxford Companion to Food</i></a>, <a href="/wiki/Oxford_University_Press" title="Oxford University Press">Oxford University Press</a>, p.&nbsp;161, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-19-967733-7" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-19-967733-7"><bdi>978-0-19-967733-7</bdi></a>, <q>Chapatis are made from finely milled whole-wheat flour, called chapati flour or atta, and water. The dough is rolled into thin rounds which vary in size from region to region and then cooked without fat or oil on a slightly curved griddle called a tava.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Oxford+Companion+to+Food&amp;rft.pages=161&amp;rft.pub=Oxford+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2014&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-19-967733-7&amp;rft.aulast=Davidson&amp;rft.aufirst=Alan&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DRL6LAwAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA161&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-tamang-yeast-idlidosa-496"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-tamang-yeast-idlidosa_496-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFTamangFleet2009" class="citation cs2">Tamang, J. P.; Fleet, G. H. (2009), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=jLFmiervaqMC&amp;pg=PA180">"Yeasts Diversity in Fermented Foods and Beverages"</a>, in Satyanarayana, T.; Kunze, G. (eds.), <i>Yeast Biotechnology: Diversity and Applications</i>, Springer, p.&nbsp;180, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-4020-8292-4" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-4020-8292-4"><bdi>978-1-4020-8292-4</bdi></a>, <q>Idli is an acid-leavened and steamed cake made by bacterial fermentation of a thick batter made from coarsely ground rice and dehulled black gram. Idli cakes are soft, moist and spongy, have desirable sour flavour, and is eaten as breakfast in South India. Dosa batter is very similar to idli batter, except that both the rice and black gram are finely grounded. The batter is thinner than that of idli and is fried as a thin, crisp pancake and eaten directly in South India.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Yeasts+Diversity+in+Fermented+Foods+and+Beverages&amp;rft.btitle=Yeast+Biotechnology%3A+Diversity+and+Applications&amp;rft.pages=180&amp;rft.pub=Springer&amp;rft.date=2009&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-4020-8292-4&amp;rft.aulast=Tamang&amp;rft.aufirst=J.+P.&amp;rft.au=Fleet%2C+G.+H.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DjLFmiervaqMC%26pg%3DPA180&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-jhala-princely-biryani-497"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-jhala-princely-biryani_497-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFJhala2015" class="citation cs2">Jhala, Angma Day (2015), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=WGpECgAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA70"><i>Royal Patronage, Power and Aesthetics in Princely India</i></a>, Routledge, p.&nbsp;70, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-317-31657-2" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-317-31657-2"><bdi>978-1-317-31657-2</bdi></a>, <q>With the ascent of the Mughal Empire in sixteenth-century India, Turkic, Persian and Afghan traditions of dress, 'architecture and cuisine' were adopted by non-Muslim indigenous elites in South Asia. In this manner, Central Asian cooking merged with older traditions within the subcontinent, to create such signature dishes as biryani (a fusion of the Persian pilau and the spice-laden dishes of Hindustan),  and the Kashmiri meat stew of Rogan Josh. It not only generated new dishes and entire cuisines, but also fostered novel modes of eating. Such newer trends included the consumption of Persian condiments, which relied heavily on almonds, pastries and quince jams, alongside Indian achars made from sweet limes, green vegetables and curds as side relishes during Mughlai meals.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Royal+Patronage%2C+Power+and+Aesthetics+in+Princely+India&amp;rft.pages=70&amp;rft.pub=Routledge&amp;rft.date=2015&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-317-31657-2&amp;rft.aulast=Jhala&amp;rft.aufirst=Angma+Day&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DWGpECgAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA70&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Panjabi1995-498"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Panjabi1995_498-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFPanjabi1995" class="citation cs2">Panjabi, Camellia (1995), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=TYCFJMLZ_-4C&amp;pg=PA158"><i>The Great Curries of India</i></a>, <a href="/wiki/Simon_and_Schuster" class="mw-redirect" title="Simon and Schuster">Simon and Schuster</a>, pp.&nbsp;158–, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-684-80383-8" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-684-80383-8"><bdi>978-0-684-80383-8</bdi></a>, <q>The Muslim influenced breads of India are leavened, like <i>naan</i>, <i>Khamiri roti</i>, ...</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Great+Curries+of+India&amp;rft.pages=158-&amp;rft.pub=Simon+and+Schuster&amp;rft.date=1995&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-684-80383-8&amp;rft.aulast=Panjabi&amp;rft.aufirst=Camellia&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DTYCFJMLZ_-4C%26pg%3DPA158&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Davidson2014-p410-499"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Davidson2014-p410_499-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Davidson2014-p410_499-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Davidson2014-p410_499-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFDavidson2014" class="citation cs2">Davidson, Alan (2014), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=RL6LAwAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA410"><i>The Oxford Companion to Food</i></a>, <a href="/wiki/Oxford_University_Press" title="Oxford University Press">Oxford University Press</a>, p.&nbsp;410, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-19-967733-7" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-19-967733-7"><bdi>978-0-19-967733-7</bdi></a></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Oxford+Companion+to+Food&amp;rft.pages=410&amp;rft.pub=Oxford+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2014&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-19-967733-7&amp;rft.aulast=Davidson&amp;rft.aufirst=Alan&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DRL6LAwAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA410&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-SahakianSaloma2016-50-500"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-SahakianSaloma2016-50_500-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFSahakianSalomaErkman2016" class="citation cs2">Sahakian, Marlyne; Saloma, Czarina; Erkman, Suren (2016), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=TBIxDQAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PT50"><i>Food Consumption in the City: Practices and patterns in urban Asia and the Pacific</i></a>, <a href="/wiki/Taylor_%26_Francis" title="Taylor &amp; Francis">Taylor &amp; Francis</a>, p.&nbsp;50, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-317-31050-1" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-317-31050-1"><bdi>978-1-317-31050-1</bdi></a></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Food+Consumption+in+the+City%3A+Practices+and+patterns+in+urban+Asia+and+the+Pacific&amp;rft.pages=50&amp;rft.pub=Taylor+%26+Francis&amp;rft.date=2016&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-317-31050-1&amp;rft.aulast=Sahakian&amp;rft.aufirst=Marlyne&amp;rft.au=Saloma%2C+Czarina&amp;rft.au=Erkman%2C+Suren&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DTBIxDQAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPT50&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-sengupta-74-503"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-sengupta-74_503-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFSengupta2014" class="citation cs2">Sengupta, Jayanta (2014), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=SNQkDQAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA74">"India"</a>, in Freedman, Paul; Chaplin, Joyce E.; Albala, Ken (eds.), <i>Food in Time and Place: The American Historical Association Companion to Food History</i>, <a href="/wiki/University_of_California_Press" title="University of California Press">University of California Press</a>, p.&nbsp;74, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-520-27745-8" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-520-27745-8"><bdi>978-0-520-27745-8</bdi></a></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=India&amp;rft.btitle=Food+in+Time+and+Place%3A+The+American+Historical+Association+Companion+to+Food+History&amp;rft.pages=74&amp;rft.pub=University+of+California+Press&amp;rft.date=2014&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-520-27745-8&amp;rft.aulast=Sengupta&amp;rft.aufirst=Jayanta&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DSNQkDQAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA74&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-CollinghamCollingham2007-504"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-CollinghamCollingham2007_504-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-CollinghamCollingham2007_504-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-CollinghamCollingham2007_504-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFCollingham2007" class="citation cs2">Collingham, Elizabeth M. (2007), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=pH88DwAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA25"><i>Curry: A Tale of Cooks and Conquerors</i></a>, <a href="/wiki/Oxford_University_Press" title="Oxford University Press">Oxford University Press</a>, p.&nbsp;25, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-19-532001-5" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-19-532001-5"><bdi>978-0-19-532001-5</bdi></a></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Curry%3A+A+Tale+of+Cooks+and+Conquerors&amp;rft.pages=25&amp;rft.pub=Oxford+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2007&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-19-532001-5&amp;rft.aulast=Collingham&amp;rft.aufirst=Elizabeth+M.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DpH88DwAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA25&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-nandy2004-505"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-nandy2004_505-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFNandy2004" class="citation cs2"><a href="/wiki/Ashis_Nandy" title="Ashis Nandy">Nandy, Ashis</a> (2004), "The Changing Popular Culture of Indian Food: Preliminary Notes", <i><a href="/wiki/South_Asia_Research" title="South Asia Research">South Asia Research</a></i>, <b>24</b> (1): 9–19, <a href="/wiki/CiteSeerX_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="CiteSeerX (identifier)">CiteSeerX</a>&nbsp;<span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/summary?doi=10.1.1.830.7136">10.1.1.830.7136</a></span>, <a href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1177%2F0262728004042760">10.1177/0262728004042760</a>, <a href="/wiki/ISSN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISSN (identifier)">ISSN</a>&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.worldcat.org/issn/0262-7280">0262-7280</a>, <a href="/wiki/S2CID_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="S2CID (identifier)">S2CID</a>&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:143223986">143223986</a></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=South+Asia+Research&amp;rft.atitle=The+Changing+Popular+Culture+of+Indian+Food%3A+Preliminary+Notes&amp;rft.volume=24&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.pages=9-19&amp;rft.date=2004&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fciteseerx.ist.psu.edu%2Fviewdoc%2Fsummary%3Fdoi%3D10.1.1.830.7136%23id-name%3DCiteSeerX&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fapi.semanticscholar.org%2FCorpusID%3A143223986%23id-name%3DS2CID&amp;rft.issn=0262-7280&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1177%2F0262728004042760&amp;rft.aulast=Nandy&amp;rft.aufirst=Ashis&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-SrinivasanJermyn2001-506"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-SrinivasanJermyn2001_506-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFSrinivasanJermynLek2001" class="citation cs2">Srinivasan, Radhika; Jermyn, Leslie; Lek, Hui Hui (2001), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=zoVby4OJWhYC&amp;pg=PA109"><i>India</i></a>, Times Books International, p.&nbsp;109, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-981-232-184-8" title="Special:BookSources/978-981-232-184-8"><bdi>978-981-232-184-8</bdi></a></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=India&amp;rft.pages=109&amp;rft.pub=Times+Books+International&amp;rft.date=2001&amp;rft.isbn=978-981-232-184-8&amp;rft.aulast=Srinivasan&amp;rft.aufirst=Radhika&amp;rft.au=Jermyn%2C+Leslie&amp;rft.au=Lek%2C+Hui+Hui&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DzoVby4OJWhYC%26pg%3DPA109&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span> Quote: "Girls in India usually play jump rope, or hopscotch, and five stones, tossing the stones up in the air and catching them in many different ways ... the coconut-plucking contests, groundnut-eating races, ... of rural India."</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEWolpert20032-507"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEWolpert20032_507-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFWolpert2003">Wolpert 2003</a>, p.&nbsp;2.</span>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Bibliography">Bibliography</span></h2>
<p><b>Overview</b>
</p>

<ul><li><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFCentral_Intelligence_Agency" class="citation cs2"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.cia.gov/the-world-factbook/countries/india/">"India"</a>, <i><a href="/wiki/The_World_Factbook" title="The World Factbook">The World Factbook</a></i>, <a href="/wiki/Central_Intelligence_Agency" title="Central Intelligence Agency">Central Intelligence Agency</a><span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">10 July</span> 2021</span></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+World+Factbook&amp;rft.atitle=India&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cia.gov%2Fthe-world-factbook%2Fcountries%2Findia%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></li>

<li><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFInternational_Monetary_Fund" class="citation cs2"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.imf.org/external/pubs/ft/weo/2011/02/weodata/weorept.aspx?sy=2009&amp;ey=2016&amp;scsm=1&amp;ssd=1&amp;sort=country&amp;ds=.&amp;br=1&amp;c=534&amp;s=NGDPD%2CNGDPDPC%2CPPPGDP%2CPPPPC%2CLP&amp;grp=0&amp;a=&amp;pr1.x=88&amp;pr1.y=9"><i>India</i></a>, <a href="/wiki/International_Monetary_Fund" title="International Monetary Fund">International Monetary Fund</a><span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">14 October</span> 2011</span></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=India&amp;rft.pub=International+Monetary+Fund&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.imf.org%2Fexternal%2Fpubs%2Fft%2Fweo%2F2011%2F02%2Fweodata%2Fweorept.aspx%3Fsy%3D2009%26ey%3D2016%26scsm%3D1%26ssd%3D1%26sort%3Dcountry%26ds%3D.%26br%3D1%26c%3D534%26s%3DNGDPD%252CNGDPDPC%252CPPPGDP%252CPPPPC%252CLP%26grp%3D0%26a%3D%26pr1.x%3D88%26pr1.y%3D9&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></li>
<li><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFProvisional_Population_Totals_Paper_1_of_2011_India" class="citation cs2"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://censusindia.gov.in/2011-prov-results/prov_results_paper1_india.html"><i>Provisional Population Totals Paper 1 of 2011 India</i></a>, <a href="/wiki/Registrar_General_and_Census_Commissioner_of_India" title="Registrar General and Census Commissioner of India">Office of the Registrar General and Census Commissioner</a><span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">18 October</span> 2021</span></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Provisional+Population+Totals+Paper+1+of+2011+India&amp;rft.pub=Office+of+the+Registrar+General+and+Census+Commissioner&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fcensusindia.gov.in%2F2011-prov-results%2Fprov_results_paper1_india.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></li>
<li>Robinson, Francis, ed. <i>The Cambridge Encyclopedia of India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nepal, Bhutan and the Maldives</i> (1989)</li>
<li><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFConstituent_Assembly_of_India1950" class="citation cs2"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110721173243/https://parliamentofindia.nic.in/ls/debates/vol12p1.htm"><i>Constituent Assembly of India – Volume XII</i></a>, <a href="/wiki/National_Informatics_Centre" title="National Informatics Centre">National Informatics Centre</a>, <a href="/wiki/Government_of_India" title="Government of India">Government of India</a>, 24 January 1950, archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://parliamentofindia.nic.in/ls/debates/vol12p1.htm">the original</a> on 21 July 2011<span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">17 July</span> 2011</span></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Constituent+Assembly+of+India+%E2%80%93+Volume+XII&amp;rft.pub=National+Informatics+Centre%2C+Government+of+India&amp;rft.date=1950-01-24&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fparliamentofindia.nic.in%2Fls%2Fdebates%2Fvol12p1.htm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></li></ul>
</div>
<p><b>Etymology</b>
</p>
<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1054258005"><div class="refbegin refbegin-columns references-column-width" style="column-width: 33em">
<ul><li><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFBarrow2003" class="citation journal cs1">Barrow, Ian J. (2003). <p><b>History</b>

<p><b>Geography</b>
</p>

<p><b>Biodiversity</b>
</p>

</div>
<p><b>Politics</b>
</p>

<p><b>Foreign relations and military</b>
</p>

<p><b>Economy</b>
</p>
<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1054258005"><div class="refbegin refbegin-columns references-column-width" style="column-width: 33em">
<ul><li><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFAlamgir2008" class="citation cs2">Alamgir, J. (2008), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=JL7QfWJ5Yk0C"><i>India's Open-Economy Policy: Globalism, Rivalry, Continuity</i></a>, <a href="/wiki/Taylor_%26_Francis" title="Taylor &amp; Francis">Taylor &amp; Francis</a>, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-415-77684-4" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-415-77684-4"><bdi>978-0-415-77684-4</bdi></a><span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">23 July</span> 2011</span></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=India%27s+Open-Economy+Policy%3A+Globalism%2C+Rivalry%2C+Continuity&amp;rft.pub=Taylor+%26+Francis&amp;rft.date=2008&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-415-77684-4&amp;rft.aulast=Alamgir&amp;rft.aufirst=J.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DJL7QfWJ5Yk0C&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></li>

</div>
<p><b>Demographics</b>
</p>

<li><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFMinistry_of_Home_Affairs_1960" class="citation cs2"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20141001005409/https://www.rajbhasha.nic.in/UI/pagecontent.aspx?pc=Mzc%3D"><i>Notification No. 2/8/60-O.L</i></a>, <a href="/wiki/Ministry_of_Home_Affairs_(India)" title="Ministry of Home Affairs (India)">Ministry of Home Affairs</a>, <a href="/wiki/Government_of_India" title="Government of India">Government of India</a>, 27 April 1960, archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://rajbhasha.nic.in/UI/pagecontent.aspx?pc=Mzc%3d">the original</a> on 1 October 2014<span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">13 May</span> 2011</span></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Notification+No.+2%2F8%2F60-O.L&amp;rft.pub=Ministry+of+Home+Affairs%2C+Government+of+India&amp;rft.date=1960-04-27&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Frajbhasha.nic.in%2FUI%2Fpagecontent.aspx%3Fpc%3DMzc%253d&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></li>
<li><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite class="citation cs2"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.censusindia.gov.in/Census_Data_2001/National_Summary/National_Summary_DataPage.aspx">"Census Data 2001"</a>, <i><a href="/wiki/Registrar_General_and_Census_Commissioner_of_India" title="Registrar General and Census Commissioner of India">Office of the Registrar General and Census Commissioner</a></i>, <a href="/wiki/Ministry_of_Home_Affairs_(India)" title="Ministry of Home Affairs (India)">Ministry of Home Affairs</a>, <a href="/wiki/Government_of_India" title="Government of India">Government of India</a>, 2010–2011<span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">22 July</span> 2011</span></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Office+of+the+Registrar+General+and+Census+Commissioner&amp;rft.atitle=Census+Data+2001&amp;rft.date=2010%2F2011&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.censusindia.gov.in%2FCensus_Data_2001%2FNational_Summary%2FNational_Summary_DataPage.aspx&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></li></ul>
</div>
<p><b>Art</b>
</p>

<li><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1133582631"><cite id="CITEREFRediff_2008_b" class="citation cs2"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.rediff.com/sports/2008/oct/29anand.htm"><i>Anand Crowned World Champion</i></a>, <a href="/wiki/Rediff.com" title="Rediff.com">Rediff</a>, 29 October 2008<span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">29 October</span> 2008</span></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Anand+Crowned+World+Champion&amp;rft.pub=Rediff&amp;rft.date=2008-10-29&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rediff.com%2Fsports%2F2008%2Foct%2F29anand.htm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></li>

</ul>
